articles.title: Legionnaires' outbreak linked as cause to pneumonia deaths in Argentina
articles.description: The cases are linked to a single private clinic in the city of San Miguel de Tucuman, according to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO). Local health officials so far have reported 11 confirmed cases, including four deaths.
articles.content: Health authorities confirmed on Saturday that an infectious pneumonia outbreak which killed four people in northwest Argentina had died of Legionnaires' disease. The cases are linked to a single private clinic in the city of San Miguel de Tucuman, ac... [1263 chars]

articles.description: Just being consistent and taking the opportunities when we create them." South Africa will face Argentina in their last two games in the competition later this month while defending champions New Zealand will play twice against Australia.

articles.title: Failed assassination gives extra punch to Argentine courtroom drama 'Argentina 1985'
articles.description: The Santiago Mitre movie follows the prosecutors who, despite death threats and enormous legal difficulties, brought members of Argentina’s 1976-1983 military dictatorship to trial in 1985
articles.content: The 79th Venice Film Festival - Premiere screening of the film "Argentina, 1985" - Red Carpet Arrivals - Venice, Italy, September 3, 2022. Cast member Alejandra Flechner and guests hold scarves referring to the 30,000 people who disappeared following... [3044 chars]

articles.title: Rugby-Ruthless All Blacks leave coach Foster delighted with Pumas victory
articles.description: All Blacks coach Ian Foster called his team's crushing 53-3 bonus point victory over Argentina on Saturday "ruthless" as New Zealand bounced back from their first-ever loss on home soil against the South Americans last week.

articles.title: Legionella suspected of causing illness that killed 3 and sickened 7 in Argentina, health officials say
articles.description: An illness that has stricken 10 people in Argentina, killing three, may have been the result of Legionella, the bacteria that causes Legionnaires’ disease,
articles.content:
An illness that has stricken 10 people in Argentina, killing three, may have been the result of Legionella, the bacteria that causes Legionnaires’ disease, health officials said Saturday.

articles.title: Attack raises doubts about Argentine VP's security protocols
articles.description: Every day for the past two weeks, the routine was the same: Argentina's powerful Vice President Cristina Fernandez was met by a crowd of feverish supporters who wanted to touch their leader. And every day she obliged and approached them.
articles.content:
Deborah Rey, The Associated Press

articles.title: Don’t take democracy for granted, warns director of Argentine junta film
articles.description: Comments at Venice film festival come after recent failed assassination attempt on Argentina’s vice-president
articles.content:
A failed assassination attempt this week on the Argentine vice-president has shown that democracy cannot be taken for granted, the director behind a courtroom drama about the trial of Argentina’s military junta has said.
